title: Global Temperature Is Rising
fact: The planet's average surface temperature has risen about 2 degrees Fahrenheit (1 degrees Celsius) since the late 19th century, a change driven largely by increased carbon dioxide emissions into the atmosphere and other human activities

title: The Ocean Is Getting Warmer
fact: The ocean has absorbed more heat from the increase in temperatures causing the ocean waters to be much warmer in the recent years. This negatively impacts ocean life.

title: The Ice Sheets Are Shrinking
fact: The Greenland and Antarctic ice sheets are melting and have decreased in mass due to increase in temperature.

title: Glaciers Are Retreating

title: Sea Level Is Rising
fact: Global sea level rose about 8 inches (20 centimeters) in the last century. The rate in the last two decades, however, is nearly double that of the last century and accelerating slightly every year.

title: Extreme Weather Events Are Increasing in Frequency
fact: extreme precipitation, droughts and forest fires have become more frequent and severe as a result of climate change.
